priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Genomic Inheritability Type Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181177

self.title: CDISC SDTM Genomic Inheritability Type Response Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to whether the variation can be passed to the next generation.
name: Genomic Inheritability Type Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Genomic Inheritability Type Response Terminology

terms.definition: Any inheritable variation in the DNA that is transmitted to the progeny with some frequency.
Any inheritable variation that appears in mitochondrial DNA that is transmitted to the progeny with some frequency.
Any non-inheritable variation in the DNA that is not transmitted to the progeny but will be maintained during any mitosis within the individual.
